article_title: Alaska legislative committee allows Medicaid lawsuit to proceed
article_text: "We are suing the governor for his unilateral and what we believe to be an unlawful expansion of Medicaid under 'Obamacare,'" Chenault said. "We are suing to better delineate the separation of powers ensconced in our Constitution. They're disappointed? I am disappointed that they are the ones choosing to put politics before the institution they ran as candidates to join."

article_metadata.description: The Alaska Legislatures lawsuit to stop Gov. Bill Walker from unilaterally expanding Medicaid will continue in Superior Court; a House-Senate committee met Monday and took no action to stop the litigation.

og.description: The Alaska Legislatures lawsuit to stop Gov. Bill Walker from unilaterally expanding Medicaid will continue in Superior Court; a House-Senate committee met Monday and took no action to stop the litigation.
og.title: Alaska legislative committee allows Medicaid lawsuit to proceed

"We are suing to better delineate the separation of powers ensconced in our Constitution.
